|rad1chip2 = Intersil;ISL3685; |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = MMCX |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== The FCC ID on the label is invalid. This is the same router as the '''Blitzz''' BWA611 ('''AboCom''' WR104K). "M01-WR14K-A10" and a date code of '''0251''' (Dec. 2002) is silkscreened on the board shown below. [http://www.netstumbler.org/hardware/help-ident-this-card-t9226.html Post on NetStumbler forums regarding the internal card], per this post the card is also used in the D-Link DCS-1000W The internal wireless card registers as a.. *PCMCIA\Wireless-LAN_Adapter-10FC *PCMCIA\Wireless-LAN_Adapter-0156-0002 under a Windows machine and 
Socket 0:
  product info: "Wireless", "LAN Adapter", "Version 01.02", ""
  manfid: 0x0156, 0x0002
  function: 6 (network)
under a Linux machine using '''pccardctl ident'''. The power adapter included with the device is a OEM AD-051A5 (5V, 1.5A). ID/OD/Len measurements are approximate. ==Pictures==
